other_tests.findings: Annular constriction (3 to 4 cm in length) with irregular mucosal contours involving the distal esophagus and gastroesophageal junction, suggestive of esophageal cancer.
Ulcerated luminal stricture in the distal esophagus extending to the gastroesophageal junction.
Transmural hypoechoic mass and multiple enlarged, round periesophageal lymph nodes, highly suspicious for cancer.
Evidence of poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma that had metastasized to the lymph nodes.

other_tests.procedure_name: CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
other_tests.findings: Decreased thickening of the esophageal wall and diminishing mediastinal and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
Evidence of disease progression, including multiple hepatic, pulmonary, and adrenal metastases with intense FDG uptake.
Transition mutation in PIK3CA gene and amplification of MET.

other_tests.procedure_name: Follow-up PET-CT after MET inhibitor therapy
other_tests.findings: Marked resolution of the hepatic, adrenal, pulmonary, and nodal metastases.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Radiographic complete response since the eighth month of treatment.
